   20: -module(os_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   23: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   24: 	 init_per_testcase/2,end_per_testcase/2]).
   25: -export([space_in_cwd/1, quoting/1, cmd_unicode/1, 
   26:          env/1,
   27:          null_in_command/1, space_in_name/1, bad_command/1,
   28: 	 find_executable/1, unix_comment_in_command/1, deep_list_command/1,
   29:          large_output_command/1, background_command/0, background_command/1,
   30:          message_leak/1, close_stdin/0, close_stdin/1, max_size_command/1,
   31:          cmd_exception/1, os_cmd_shell/1, os_cmd_shell_peer/1,
   32:          perf_counter_api/1, error_info/1]).
   33: 
   34: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   35: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   36: 
   37: suite() ->
   38:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   39:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
   40: 
   41: all() ->
   42:     [space_in_cwd, quoting, cmd_unicode, null_in_command,
   43:      space_in_name, bad_command,
   44:      env,
   45:      find_executable, unix_comment_in_command, deep_list_command,
   46:      large_output_command, background_command, message_leak,
   47:      close_stdin, max_size_command, perf_counter_api,
   48:      error_info, os_cmd_shell, os_cmd_shell_peer,
   49:      cmd_exception].
   50: 
   51: groups() ->
   52:     [].
   53: 
   54: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   55:     Config.
   56: 
   57: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   58:     ok.
   59: 
   60: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   61:     Config.
   62: 
   63: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   64:     Config.
   65: 
   66: init_per_testcase(TC, Config)
   67:   when TC =:= background_command; TC =:= close_stdin ->
   68:     case os:type() of
   69:         {win32, _} ->
   70:             {skip,"Should not work on windows"};
   71:         _ ->
   72:             Config
   73:     end;
   74: init_per_testcase(_TC,Config) ->
   75:     Config.
   76: 
   77: end_per_testcase(_,_Config) ->
   78:     ok.
   79: 
   80: env(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   81:     Env0 = os:env(),
   82:     GetEnv0 = os:getenv(),
   83:     lists:foldl(fun({K,V}, [KV | T]) ->
   84:                         KV = K ++ "=" ++ V,
   85:                         V = os:getenv(K),
   86:                         V = os:getenv(K, default),
   87:                         T
   88:                 end,
   89:                 GetEnv0,
   90:                 Env0),
   91:     ok.
   92: 
   93: %% Test that executing a command in a current working directory
   94: %% with space in its name works.
   95: space_in_cwd(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   96:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
   97:     Dirname = filename:join(PrivDir, "cwd with space"),
   98:     ok = file:make_dir(Dirname),
   99:     ok = file:set_cwd(Dirname),
  100: 
  101:     %% Using `more' gives the almost the same result on both Unix and Windows.
  102: 
  103:     Cmd = case os:type() of
  104: 	      {win32, _} ->
  105: 		  "more";
  106: 	      {unix, _} ->
  107: 		  "more </dev/null"
  108: 	  end,
  109: 
  110:     case os:cmd(Cmd) of
  111: 	[] -> ok;				% Unix.
  112: 	"\r\n" -> ok;			% Windows.
  113: 	Other ->
  114: 	    ct:fail({unexpected, Other})
  115:     end,
  116: 
  117:     ct:sleep(5),
  118:     [] = receive_all(),
  119:     ok.
  120: 
  121: %% Test that various ways of quoting arguments work.
  122: quoting(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  123:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  124:     Echo = filename:join(DataDir, "my_echo"),
  125: 
  126:     comp("one", os:cmd(Echo ++ " one")),
  127:     comp("one::two", os:cmd(Echo ++ " one two")),
  128:     comp("one two", os:cmd(Echo ++ " \"one two\"")),
  129:     comp("x::one two::y", os:cmd(Echo ++ " x \"one two\" y")),
  130:     comp("x::one two", os:cmd(Echo ++ " x \"one two\"")),
  131:     comp("one two::y", os:cmd(Echo ++ " \"one two\" y")),
  132:     comp("x::::y", os:cmd(Echo ++ " x \"\" y")),
  133:     ct:sleep(5),
  134:     [] = receive_all(),
  135:     ok.
  136: 
  137: 
  138: %% Test that unicode arguments work.
  139: cmd_unicode(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  140:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  141:     Echo = filename:join(DataDir, "my_echo"),
  142: 
  143:     comp("one", os:cmd(Echo ++ " one")),
  144:     comp("one::two", os:cmd(Echo ++ " one two")),
  145:     comp("åäö::ϼΩ", os:cmd(Echo ++ " åäö " ++ [1020, 937])),
  146:     ct:sleep(5),
  147:     [] = receive_all(),
  148:     ok.
  149: 
  150: null_in_command(_Config) ->
  151:     {Ok, Error} = case os:type() of
  152:                       {win32,_} -> {"dir", "di\0r"};
  153:                       _ -> {"ls", "l\0s"}
  154:                   end,
  155:     true = is_list(try os:cmd(Ok) catch Class0:_ -> Class0 end),
  156:     error = try os:cmd(Error) catch Class1:_ -> Class1 end,
  157:     ok.
  158: 
  159: %% Test that program with a space in its name can be executed.
  160: space_in_name(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  161:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  162:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  163:     Spacedir = filename:join(PrivDir, "program files"),
  164:     Ext = case os:type() of
  165: 	      {win32,_} -> ".exe";
  166: 	      _ -> ""
  167: 	  end,
  168:     OrigEcho = filename:join(DataDir, "my_echo" ++ Ext),
  169:     Echo0 = filename:join(Spacedir, "my_echo" ++ Ext),
  170: 
  171:     %% Copy the `my_echo' program to a directory whose name contains a space.
  172: 
  173:     ok = file:make_dir(Spacedir),
  174:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(OrigEcho),
  175:     ok = file:write_file(Echo0, Bin),
  176:     Echo = filename:nativename(Echo0),
  177:     ok = file:change_mode(Echo, 8#777),	% Make it executable on Unix.
  178: 
  179:     %% Run the echo program.
  180:     %% Quoting on windows depends on if the full path of the executable
  181:     %% contains special characters. Paths when running common_tests always
  182:     %% include @, why Windows would always fail if we do not double the
  183:     %% quotes (this is the behaviour of cmd.exe, not Erlang's idea).
  184:     Quote = case os:type() of
  185:                 {win32,_} ->
  186: 		    case (Echo -- "&<>()@^|") =:= Echo of
  187: 		        true -> "\"";
  188: 			false -> "\"\""
  189: 	 	    end;
  190: 		_ ->
  191: 		    "\""
  192: 	    end,
  193:     comp("", os:cmd(Quote ++ Echo ++ Quote)),
  194:     comp("a::b::c", os:cmd(Quote ++ Echo ++ Quote ++ " a b c")),
  195:     ct:sleep(5),
  196:     [] = receive_all(),
  197:     ok.
  198: 
  199: %% Check that a bad command doesn't crasch the server or the emulator (it used to).
  200: bad_command(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  201:     catch os:cmd([a|b]),
  202:     catch os:cmd({bad, thing}),
  203: 
  204:     %% This should at least not crash (on Unix it typically returns
  205:     %% a message from the shell).
  206:     os:cmd("xxxxx"),
  207: 
  208:     ok.
  209: 
  210: cmd_exception(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  211: 
  212:     {Osfamily, Ostype} = os:type(),
  213: 
  214:     %% command failed
  215:     {Res, 3} = cmd_exception_test("echo abc && exit 3"),
  216:     Osfamily =:= unix andalso ?assertEqual("abc\n", Res),
  217:     Osfamily =:= win32 andalso ?assertEqual("abc \r\n", Res),
  218: 
  219:     %% Syntax error
  220:     {_, ExitCode} = cmd_exception_test("{)"),
  221:     Osfamily =:= unix andalso Ostype =/= sunos andalso ?assertEqual(2, ExitCode),
  222:     Osfamily =:= unix andalso Ostype =:= sunos andalso ?assertEqual(3, ExitCode),
  223:     Osfamily =:= win32 andalso ?assertEqual(1, ExitCode),
  224: 
  225:     ok.
  226: 
  227: cmd_exception_test(Cmd) ->
  228:     Out = os:cmd(Cmd), %% Check that no exception is generated when the option is not given
  229:     try
  230:         os:cmd(Cmd, #{ exception_on_failure => true}),
  231:         ct:fail("Should not succeed")
  232:     catch error:{command_failed, ErrorOut, Reason} ->
  233:             %% Check that the output is the same
  234:             ?assertEqual(Out, ErrorOut),
  235:             {ErrorOut, Reason}
  236:     end.
  237: 
  238: 
  239: find_executable(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  240:     case os:type() of
  241: 	{win32, _} ->
  242: 	    DataDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "win32"),
  243: 	    ok = file:set_cwd(filename:join([DataDir, "current"])),
  244: 	    Bin = filename:join(DataDir, "bin"),
  245: 	    Abin = filename:join(DataDir, "abin"),
  246: 	    UsrBin = filename:join([DataDir, "usr", "bin"]),
  247: 	    {ok, Current} = file:get_cwd(),
  248: 
  249: 	    Path = lists:concat([Bin, ";", Abin, ";", UsrBin]),
  250: 	    io:format("Path = ~s", [Path]),
  251: 
  252: 	    %% Search for programs in Bin (second element in PATH).
  253: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_ar", ".exe", Path),
  254: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_ascii", ".com", Path),
  255: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_adb", ".bat", Path),
  256: 	    %% OTP-3626 find names of executables given with extension
  257: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_ar.exe", "", Path),
  258: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_ascii.com", "", Path),
  259: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_adb.bat", "", Path),
  260: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_ar.EXE", "", Path),
  261: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_ascii.COM", "", Path),
  262: 	    find_exe(Abin, "MY_ADB.BAT", "", Path),
  263: 
  264: 	    %% Search for programs in Abin (second element in PATH).
  265: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_ar", ".exe", Path),
  266: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_ascii", ".com", Path),
  267: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_adb", ".bat", Path),
  268: 
  269: 	    %% Search for programs in the current working directory.
  270: 	    find_exe(Current, "my_program", ".exe", Path),
  271: 	    find_exe(Current, "my_command", ".com", Path),
  272: 	    find_exe(Current, "my_batch", ".bat", Path),
  273: 	    ok;
  274: 	{unix, _}  ->
  275: 	    DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  276: 
  277: 	    %% Smoke test.
  278: 	    case ct:get_progname() of
  279: 		"erl" ->
  280: 		    ErlPath = os:find_executable("erl"),
  281: 		    true = is_list(ErlPath),
  282: 		    true = filelib:is_regular(ErlPath);
  283: 		_ ->
  284: 		    %% Don't bother -- the progname could include options.
  285: 		    ok
  286: 	    end,
  287: 
  288: 	    %% Never return a directory name.
  289: 	    false = os:find_executable("unix", [DataDir]),
  290: 	    ok
  291:     end.
  292: 
  293: find_exe(Where, Name, Ext, Path) ->
  294:     Expected = filename:join(Where, Name++Ext),
  295:     case os:find_executable(Name, Path) of
  296: 	Expected ->
  297: 	    ok;
  298: 	Name when is_list(Name) ->
  299: 	    case filename:absname(Name) of
  300: 		Expected ->
  301: 		    ok;
  302: 		Other ->
  303: 		    io:format("Expected ~p; got (converted to absolute) ~p",
  304: 			      [Expected, Other]),
  305: 		    ct:fail(failed)
  306: 	    end;
  307: 	Other ->
  308: 	    io:format("Expected ~p; got ~p", [Expected, Other]),
  309: 	    ct:fail(failed)
  310:     end.
  311: 
  312: %% OTP-1805: Test that os:cmd(\ls #\) works correctly (used to hang).
  313: unix_comment_in_command(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  314:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  315:     ok = file:set_cwd(Priv),
  316:     _ = os:cmd("ls #"),			% Any result is ok.
  317:     ct:sleep(5),
  318:     [] = receive_all(),
  319:     ok.
  320: 
  321: %% Check that a deep list in command works equally on unix and on windows.
  322: deep_list_command(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  323:     %% As a 'io_lib' module description says: "There is no guarantee that the
  324:     %% character lists returned from some of the functions are flat, they can
  325:     %% be deep lists."
  326:     %% That's why os:cmd/1 can have arguments that are deep lists.
  327:     %% It is not a problem for unix, but for windows it is (in R15B02 for ex.).
  328:     Echo = os:cmd([$e, $c, "ho"]),
  329:     true = erlang:is_list(Echo),
  330:     %% FYI: [$e, $c, "ho"] =:= io_lib:format("ec~s", ["ho"])
  331:     ok.
  332: 
  333: %% Test to make sure that the correct data is
  334: %% received when doing large commands.
  335: large_output_command(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  336:     %% Maximum allowed on windows is 8192, so we test well below that
  337:     AAA = lists:duplicate(7000, $a),
  338:     comp(AAA,os:cmd("echo " ++ AAA)).
  339: 
  340: %% Test that it is possible on unix to start a background task using os:cmd.
  341: background_command() ->
  342:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 5}}].
  343: background_command(_Config) ->
  344:     %% This testcase fails when the os:cmd takes
  345:     %% longer then the 5 second timeout
  346:     os:cmd("sleep 10&").
  347: 
  348: %% Test that message does not leak to the calling process
  349: message_leak(_Config) ->
  350:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  351: 
  352:     os:cmd("echo hello"),
  353:     [] = receive_all(),
  354: 
  355:     case os:type() of
  356:         {unix, _} ->
  357:             os:cmd("for i in $(seq 1 100); do echo hello; done&"),
  358:             [] = receive_all();
  359:         _ ->
  360:             ok % Cannot background on non-unix
  361:     end,
  362: 
  363:     process_flag(trap_exit, false).
  364: 
  365: %% Test that os:cmd closes stdin of the program that is executed
  366: close_stdin() ->
  367:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 5}}].
  368: close_stdin(Config) ->
  369:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  370:     Fds = filename:join(DataDir, "my_fds"),
  371: 
  372:     "0" = os:cmd(Fds).
  373: 
  374: max_size_command(_Config) ->
  375:     WSL = case os:getenv("WSLENV") of
  376:               false -> "";
  377:               _ -> "wsl "
  378:           end,
  379: 
  380:     Res20 = os:cmd(WSL ++ "cat /dev/zero", #{ max_size => 20 }),
  381:     20 = length(Res20),
  382: 
  383:     Res0 = os:cmd(WSL ++ "cat /dev/zero", #{ max_size => 0 }),
  384:     0 = length(Res0),
  385: 
  386:     Res32768 = os:cmd(WSL ++ "cat /dev/zero", #{ max_size => 32768 }),
  387:     32768 = length(Res32768),
  388: 
  389:     ResHello = string:trim(os:cmd("echo hello", #{ max_size => 20 })),
  390:     5 = length(ResHello).
  391: 
  392: %% Test that the os:perf_counter api works as expected
  393: perf_counter_api(_Config) ->
  394: 
  395:     true = is_integer(os:perf_counter()),
  396:     true = os:perf_counter() > 0,
  397: 
  398:     Conv = fun(T1, T2) ->
  399:                    erlang:convert_time_unit(T2 - T1, perf_counter, nanosecond)
  400:            end,
  401: 
  402:     do_perf_counter_test([], Conv, 120000000, 80000000),
  403:     do_perf_counter_test([1000], fun(T1, T2) -> T2 - T1 end, 120, 80).
  404: 
  405: do_perf_counter_test(CntArgs, Conv, Upper, Lower) ->
  406:     %% We run the test multiple times to try to get a somewhat
  407:     %% stable value... what does this test? That the
  408:     %% calculate_perf_counter_unit in sys_time.c works somewhat ok.
  409:     do_perf_counter_test(CntArgs, Conv, Upper, Lower, 10).
  410: 
  411: do_perf_counter_test(CntArgs, _Conv, Upper, Lower, 0) ->
  412:     ct:fail("perf_counter_test ~p ~p ~p",[CntArgs, Upper, Lower]);
  413: do_perf_counter_test(CntArgs, Conv, Upper, Lower, Iters) ->
  414: 
  415:     T1 = apply(os, perf_counter, CntArgs),
  416:     timer:sleep(100),
  417:     T2 = apply(os, perf_counter, CntArgs),
  418:     TsDiff = Conv(T1, T2),
  419:     ct:log("T1: ~p~n"
  420:            "T2: ~p~n"
  421:            "TsDiff: ~p~n",
  422:            [T1,T2,TsDiff]),
  423: 
  424:     if
  425:         TsDiff < Upper, TsDiff > Lower ->
  426:             ok;
  427:         true ->
  428:             do_perf_counter_test(CntArgs, Conv, Upper, Lower, Iters-1)
  429:     end.
  430: 
  431: error_info(Config) ->
  432: 
  433: 
  434:     ExhaustFDs =
  435:         fun(M,F,A) ->
  436:                 case no_limit_for_opened_files() of
  437:                     false ->
  438:                         {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  439:                         FN = filename:join(
  440:                                proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  441:                                "error_info"),
  442:                         try
  443:                             erpc:call(
  444:                               Node,
  445:                               fun() ->
  446:                                       io:format("Starting to open files..."),
  447:                                       (fun FDs(N) ->
  448:                                                case file:open(FN, [write]) of
  449:                                                    {ok, _ } -> FDs(N+1);
  450:                                                    {error, _} ->
  451:                                                        io:format("Opened ~p files",[N])
  452:                                                end
  453:                                        end)(0),
  454:                                       apply(M,F,A)
  455:                               end)
  456:                         catch error:{exception, ErrorReason, StackTrace} ->
  457:                                 erlang:raise(error, ErrorReason, StackTrace)
  458:                         after
  459:                             peer:stop(Peer)
  460:                         end;
  461:                     true ->
  462:                         apply(M,F,A)
  463:                 end
  464:         end,
  465: 
  466:     L = [{cmd, [{no, string}]},
  467:          {cmd, [["echo 1",0,0,0,1]]},
  468:          {cmd, [{no, string}, #{}]},
  469:          {cmd, [{no, string}, no_map]},
  470:          {cmd, ["echo 1"], [{general, "too many open files \\(emfile\\)"},
  471:                             {wrapper, ExhaustFDs}] ++
  472:               [no_fail || no_limit_for_opened_files()]},
  473: 
  474:          {find_executable, 1},                  %Not a BIF.
  475:          {find_executable, 2},                  %Not a BIF.
  476: 
  477:          {getenv, [a]},
  478:          {getenv, [[<<"bin">>]]},
  479:          {getenv, [[-1]]},
  480:          {getenv, [[999999999999999]]},
  481:          {getenv, [["abc"|improper_tail]]},
  482:          {getenv, ["abc="]},
  483:          {getenv, ["abc\0xyz"]},
  484: 
  485:          {getenv,[a, default]},
  486: 
  487:          {perf_counter,[bad_time_unit]},
  488: 
  489:          {putenv, [<<"bad_key">>, <<"bad_value">>],[{1,".*"},{2,".*"}]},
  490:          {putenv, ["key", <<"bad_value">>]},
  491:          {putenv, [<<"bad_key">>, "value"]},
  492:          {putenv, ["abc=", "xyz"]},
  493: 
  494:          {set_signal, [{bad,signal}, ignore]},
  495:          {set_signal, [{bad,signal}, ignore]},
  496:          {set_signal, [bad_signal, bad_handling]},
  497:          {set_signal, [{bad,signal}, bad_handling],[{1,".*"},{2,".*"}]},
  498: 
  499:          {system_time, [bad_time_unit]},
  500:          {unsetenv, [{bad,key}]}
  501:         ],
  502:     error_info_lib:test_error_info(os, L).
  503: 
  504: %% Check that is *not* possible to change shell after startup
  505: os_cmd_shell(_Config) ->
  506: 
  507:     application:set_env(kernel, os_cmd_shell, "broken shell"),
  508: 
  509:     %% os:cmd should continue to work as normal
  510:     comp("hello", os:cmd("echo hello")).
  511: 
  512: %% When started with os_cmd_shell set, we make sure that it is used.
  513: os_cmd_shell_peer(Config) ->
  514:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  515:     SysShell = "\"" ++ filename:join(DataDir, "sys_shell") ++ "\"",
  516:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-kernel","os_cmd_shell", SysShell]),
  517:     try erpc:call(Node, os, cmd, ["ls"], rtnode:timeout(normal)) of
  518:         "sys_shell" -> ok;
  519:         Other -> ct:fail({unexpected, Other})
  520:     catch
  521:         C:R:Stk ->
  522:             io:format("~p\n~p\n~p\n", [C,R,Stk]),
  523:             ct:fail(failed)
  524:     after
  525:         peer:stop(Peer)
  526:     end.
  527: 
  528: no_limit_for_opened_files() ->
  529:     case os:type() of
  530:         {unix, freebsd} ->
  531:             %% At least some FreeBSD systems support about one million open
  532:             %% files, which means that we run out of Erlang processes before we
  533:             %% reach the open file limit.
  534:             true;
  535:         {unix, _} ->
  536:             false;
  537:         _ ->
  538:             true
  539:     end.
  540: 
  541: %% Util functions
  542: 
  543: comp(Expected, Got) ->
  544:     case strip_nl(Got) of
  545: 	Expected ->
  546: 	    ok;
  547: 	Other ->
  548: 	    ok = io:format("Expected: ~ts\n", [Expected]),
  549: 	    ok = io:format("Got:      ~ts\n", [Other]),
  550: 	    ct:fail(failed)
  551:     end.
  552: 
  553: %% strips \n and \r\n from end of string
  554: 
  555: strip_nl([$\r, $\n]) -> [];
  556: strip_nl([$\n])      -> [];
  557: strip_nl([H|T])      -> [H|strip_nl(T)];
  558: strip_nl([])         -> [].
  559: 
  560: receive_all() ->
  561:     receive
  562: 	X -> [X|receive_all()]
  563:     after 0 -> []
  564:     end.
